elements.name: question2
elements.title: Maya's gross annual salary is CHF 50,000 and her net annual salary is CHF 47,000. She applies for an apartment that costs CHF 1500.-/month net and CHF 1700.-/month gross.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: Justification:
elements.correctAnswer:
The gross rent is too high in view of Maya's salary because the gross monthly rent makes up more than a third of her net income: 
CHF 1700.- (gross monthly rent) > CHF 1306.- (CHF 47 000.-/12 = net monthly salary = CHF 3917.-/3 = CHF 1306.-)

elements.name: question3
elements.title: In the application form, she points out without being asked that she is a non-smoker and has no pets (both of which are true).

elements.name: panel2
elements.title: First decide whether the respective action is rather clumsy or unproblematic by ticking the appropriate box. If you classify an action as "awkward", then show exactly what is awkward about it. Aid: "Application procedure and contract conclusion" tool.

elements.name: question5
elements.title: She politely points out to the real estate company that she does not have to answer the question about her approximate annual income.

elements.name: question6
elements.title: Justification:
elements.correctAnswer: This question is permissible because the landlord rightly wants to assess whether the tenant can pay the rent without any problems.

elements.name: question7
elements.title: She politely points out to the real estate company that she does not have to answer the question about the duration of her current employment relationship.

elements.name: question8
elements.title: Justification:
elements.correctAnswer: She does not actually have to answer this question, but she should still state that she has been employed by the same company for years (even if this point is not true). This will not reduce her chances.

elements.name: question9
elements.title: She applies for a rental apartment that can be terminated for the first time after 4 years.

elements.name: question10
elements.title: Justification:
elements.correctAnswer: This long rental period without the option to terminate is only recommended if the price-performance ratio of the apartment is obviously attractive. In this case, Maya could simply find a new tenant.

elements.name: question11
elements.title: She encloses a current extract from the debt collection register with her application documents without being asked.
